content.text:
This claim uses counterfactual language: "If the Codebase Community had disabled voting for one hour on 2010-07-20, a different date would have held the record for the most votes."

This is a hypothetical "what if" scenario — it asks what would have happened if voting had been disabled for one hour on a specific date. The database only records what actually happened, not what would have happened under hypothetical changes. Per my instructions, counterfactual claims must always be classified as NOT ENOUGH INFO.
